title: Liverpool youngster Harvey Elliott given 14-day ban over offensive Harry Kane video
text:
Liverpool’s teenage star Harvey Elliott has been given a 14-day ban by the Football Association after apologising for a video post in which he used derogatory language about Tottenham striker Harry Kane.

Elliott was charged by the FA after footage emerged of a private Snapchat video dating back to the Champions League final in June.

The teenager admitted a breach of rule E3 which forbids ‘abusive and/or insulting language and/or behaviour which included reference to a disability’.

Liverpool will not be appealing against the punishment.

Elliott, who was still a Fulham player at the time of the incident, issued a statement acknowledging his ‘immature and senseless’ actions.
